definition: to fight desperately (at the risk of one's life)
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: Players jostle and collide realistically while trying to win balls.
sentences.chinese: 球员们在争夺球时真实地拼抢。

sentences.english: Many small and medium-size Chinese businesses are highly leveraged and have to scramble for cash.
sentences.chinese: 很多中国的中小型公司都借高利贷得去拼抢现金。

sentences.english: This indicates the harshness of your team's tackling within a match.
sentences.chinese: 这项表示你的球队在比赛时的拼抢强度。

sentences.english: When does jostling for position become a foul?
sentences.chinese: 拼抢什么时候成了犯规？

sentences.english: Without work experience, young job seekers will need to scramble for options, he said.
sentences.chinese: 没有工作经验，年轻的求职者被迫拼抢任何一份工作。

definition: to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
(sports) to steal/to intercept the ball
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
to defend/to protect (against)
sliding tackle (soccer)
pass (in soccer)/to feed (ball)
restricted area/forbidden region
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
half of a game or contest/half-court
promotion (for a product)/advertisement
fast break/quick attack (ball sports)
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
to score
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
